Purpose: Practice the fundamental VAT calculation that underpins all VAT compliance work: converting between net and gross amounts and isolating the VAT element. Learners understand how VAT is added to prices and how to extract VAT from VAT-inclusive amounts.
Inputs: Amount (number) | VAT rate (percentage) | Calculation direction: either 'Add VAT to net amount' or 'Extract VAT from gross amount'
Outputs: Net amount | VAT amount | Gross amount | Calculation breakdown showing the formula used
User_Flow: 1. User selects calculation direction: 'Add VAT to net amount' or 'Extract VAT from gross amount'. 2. User enters the amount (net or gross depending on direction selected). 3. User enters the VAT rate as a percentage. 4. User clicks 'Calculate'. 5. Results panel displays: net amount and gross amount and VAT amount and the formula used (e.g. 'Net £100 × 20% = £20 VAT'). 6. User can click 'Clear' to reset all fields and start a new calculation.
Limitations: Does NOT: determine which VAT rate applies to a supply | validate whether VAT should be charged | handle multiple rates in one calculation | connect to any tax authority system | store or track transactions | generate returns or compliance reports. User must know the applicable rate before using this tool.

Purpose: Comprehensive 3-step calculator combining ETR calculation and SBIE computation and Top-up Tax determination. Learners progress through the complete GloBE calculation workflow with data flowing between steps.
Inputs: Step 1 (ETR): GloBE Income | Adjusted Covered Taxes | Jurisdiction | Step 2 (SBIE): Fiscal Year | Eligible Payroll | Tangible Assets NBV | Step 3 (Top-up): QDMTT Amount (optional)
Outputs: Step 1: ETR % | Top-up Tax % | Status | Step 2: Payroll SBIE | Asset SBIE | Total SBIE | Step 3: Excess Profit | Gross Top-up Tax | Net Top-up Tax | Complete calculation summary
User_Flow: 1. User completes Step 1 (ETR) - enters GloBE Income and Adjusted Covered Taxes. 2. Results show ETR and top-up tax percentage. 3. User proceeds to Step 2 (SBIE) - selects fiscal year and enters payroll/assets. 4. SBIE amounts calculated with transitional rates. 5. User proceeds to Step 3 (Top-up Tax) - data flows from Steps 1-2. 6. Final top-up tax calculated. 7. Summary shows complete calculation chain.
Data_Required: None - user provides values from case study
Limitations: Does NOT: perform individual GloBE income adjustments from financial statements | calculate Adjusted Covered Taxes from tax expense components | handle allocation between IIR and UTPR | connect to any tax system | generate actual GIR filings. Consolidates previous GIR-001 + GIR-002 + GIR-003.
Used_By: GloBE Information Return: Complete Filing Implementation

Purpose: Practice assessing whether a jurisdiction qualifies for the Transitional CbCR Safe Harbour using CbCR data (not GloBE-adjusted figures). Learners understand the three tests and which jurisdictions require full GloBE calculations.
Inputs: Fiscal Year (dropdown: 2024-2026) | CbCR Revenue (currency) | CbCR Profit Before Tax (currency) | Simplified Covered Taxes (currency) | SBIE Amount (currency - for Routine Profits test)
Outputs: Test results for: De Minimis Test (Pass/Fail with €10M/€1M thresholds) | Simplified ETR Test (Pass/Fail with threshold by year) | Routine Profits Test (Pass/Fail) | Overall Safe Harbour Status | Recommendation
User_Flow: 1. User selects Fiscal Year (ETR threshold varies: 15% for 2024 | 16% for 2025 | 17% for 2026). 2. User enters CbCR Revenue. 3. User enters CbCR Profit Before Tax. 4. User enters Simplified Covered Taxes. 5. User enters SBIE Amount. 6. User clicks 'Check Safe Harbour'. 7. Results panel displays: each test result | Overall status | Clear recommendation. 8. Pass ANY ONE test = Safe Harbour applies.
Data_Required: None - user provides values from case study
Limitations: Does NOT: validate CbCR data quality | determine if CbCR is 'qualified' | handle QDMTT Safe Harbour | use GloBE-adjusted figures | connect to any tax system. Uses CbCR data only. Previously GIR-004.
Used_By: GloBE Information Return: Complete Filing Implementation

User clicks 'Calculate Deadline'. 6. Results display: standard deadline | extension if applicable | countdown | milestone timeline for preparation. 7. Timeline shows: Initial Assessment | Data Collection | Calculation | Review | Filing | Post-Filing.
Data_Required: None - user provides values from case study
Limitations: Does NOT: track actual filing status | send reminders | connect to tax authority calendars | account for all possible extensions | provide legal deadline advice. Previously GIR-005.
Used_By: GloBE Information Return: Complete Filing Implementation
